meanings.def: a small container that is like a bowl in shape, usually with a handle, used for drinking tea, coffee, etc.
examples: He filled the cup with water.
a coffee cup
a cup and saucer
a plastic/paper cup
Customers don't like drinking out of plastic cups.
She raised her cup to her lips.
She was so thirsty that she drained her cup.
She drank the whole cup.
cup of something Would you like a cup of tea?
Enrique stirred his fourth cup of coffee of the day.
I drink about ten cups of coffee a day.
I like a good strong cup of tea first thing in the morning.
I'm making tea. Can I pour you a cup?
My coffee was cold, so I ordered a fresh cup.
You sit down and I'll make you a nice cup of tea.

meanings.def: a gold or silver cup on a stem, often with two handles, that is given as a prize in a competition
examples: She's won several cups for skating.
He lifted the cup (= won) for the fifth time this year.
The cup will be presented to the winning team by the president himself.
Who won the cup?

meanings.def: a sports competition in which a cup is given as a prize
examples: the World Cup
The team finished runners-up in the league and cup.
They lost to Portugal in the World Cup quarter finals.
Will Liverpool secure a place in next year's UEFA Cup?
They were the surprise winners of last year's America's Cup.
Sunderland beat Port Vale at the beginning of their cup run (= a series of winning games in a competition to win a cup).
the Ryder Cup competition
They were the first Turkish team to win a major cup competition.
The team are ready for next week's World Cup clash with Italy.

meanings.def: a unit for measuring quantity used in cooking mainly in the US; a metal or plastic container used to measure this quantity
examples: two cups of flour and half a cup of butter

meanings.def: a thing that has the shape of a cup
examples: an egg cup

meanings.def: one of the two parts of a bra that cover the breasts
examples: a C cup

meanings.def: a drink made from wine mixed with, for example, fruit juice
the hole on the green, or the metal container inside it, that you must get the ball into
a piece of plastic that a man wears over his sex organs to protect them while he is playing a sport

examples: He gets very maudlin when he's in his cups.

meanings.def: not what somebody likes or is interested in
examples: An evening at the opera isn't everyone's cup of tea.
He's nice enough but not really my cup of tea.

meanings.def: nothing is completely certain until it really happens because things can easily go wrong

meanings.def: to make your hands into the shape of a bowl
examples: She held the bird gently in cupped hands.

meanings.def: to hold something, making your hands into a round shape
examples: He cupped her face in his hands and kissed her.
